Recap: At the Bauer BarBQ, Rick talks with Michelle and his dad. Later, Jude wants Gus to be his partner in a race, but Rick takes Jude away from him. Coop and Ava arrive, she reveals her gorgeous body in a bikini and Lizzie makes gagging noises in disgust. Beth and Blake avoid Rick. Leah fakes being sick when she realizes that Mel will work instead of going to the BarBQ. After Mel and Rick examine her at the hospital, both realize she is faking and Mel comes back to the BarBQ. Alan tells Reva that she and her family will not have anything to do with the baby. Josh tells Cassie that it is easier to miss Reva now. He makes a toast to Ross at the Bauer's and Cassie is very impressed with him. They look into each other's eyes. Frank tells Olivia that he realizes their relationship will not work. Later, she turns to Buzz and they kiss passionately. Jonathan barges in at the BarBQ, rips up Alan's papers and tells him that he and his family are stuck with him for Alan has threatened his (Jonathan) mother and his family.
Transcript: Rick: Well, I love you too, sweetheart. Michelle... yes, it's not the same without you. Just... do me a favor, tell Robbie and Danny and Hope hi for me, would you? Yeah, put him back on. Go ahead. Yes, Dad? Yes, Dad, everything's under control. The flag? Yeah, I put it up first thing this morning. Looks great. Uh-huh. Why would I do that, Dad? Why would I clean the barbecue? It makes the burgers taste funny. You taught me that; that's who taught me that. Yeah. Listen, Dad, I'd love to visit, but I've got a lot of work to do. Can we talk later on this evening? Okay. I love you. Bye. Okay. Hey! Hi, sweetheart.
Leah: Hey.
Rick: How are you doing? You just missed your grandpa.
Leah: Oh, well. Add him to the list. Add him to the list of missing Bauer's.
Rick: Oh, come on, honey. You've got your mom and me, you know? That's a family.
Leah: No, I've got you. Mom's getting ready for work.
Rick: So I hear you're going to work today.
Mel: Saffron wanted to take his kids to the lake.
Rick: I don't care about Saffron. You're going to miss the barbecue.
Mel: I'll be back for the fireworks.
Rick: Well, you know what? You might as well not come back, because you're going to miss the whole thing.
Mel: You know how much I love this day, okay? And I know how important it is for your family.
Rick: Our family. It's our family.
Mel: But pretending that everything is okay when it's not, it's... ( sighs ) Look, it doesn't mean that you guys can't have fun, okay? I want you to have a good day.
Rick: Oh, so that's it?
Mel: Just tell everyone...
Rick: Everyone is going to know that you're not here. Is that what you want?
Mel: I'll see you later.
Rick: Okay. Thank you.

Ava: My first Bauer barbecue. I hear it's a major Springfield event.

Frank: Nope.

Ava: We can wait. It's...
Frank: You know, it's not a problem. She can hook up with us at the Bauer's', all right? Come on.

Ava: Yeah.
Coop: All right.

Lillian: Hello? Anybody home?

Beth: I'm leaving.
Lizzie: Me, too.

Lillian: No, no, no, you're not. Both of you come here. Come here, and just stop it. I'm so fed up with the two of you thinking about your problems all the time. Now, it's July 4th. I wish you two would get over yourselves, just for once.

Jonathan: I don't care about seeing her. I signed Alan's paper.

Reva: So you're just going to walk away?
Jonathan: I love Tammy. I don't feel anything for Lizzie's kid.
Reva: Yeah, well, you say that now. But take it from a gal who knows better that love has a funny way of creeping up on you, especially when you don't want it to.

Rick: Is it a sharp pain, honey, or is it a dull one?

Rick: Hm.
Mel: Hm. Yeah, you know what, it could be Mylodigerosis.
Rick: Yeah, or Astral Hyperbole. That's really bad.
Mel: Right... okay, you know what? Blood work.
Rick: Yeah, an MRI, and we're going to need a transfusion, just get the whole thing cleaned out.
Leah: No... no needles.
Mel: What? Honey, I am a pro, okay? It's not going to hurt... much.
Rick: You need to get back on the table and let your mother take care of you.
Mel: Be a big girl, come on, Leah.
Leah: No, you're not sticking me with that thing.
Mel: Leah. If you're sick, we need to take care of you, honey.
Leah: ( Laughs ) I'm not sick. I faked the whole thing.
Mel: Really. Now, why would you do something like that?
Leah: It's the Fourth of July, Mom.
Mel: I realize that.
Leah: The Bauer barbecue. Bauer barbecue ... we shouldn't be apart today. I had to find a way to get us together.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: Hey, you made it!
Jonathan: Yeah. Hey... hey. You don't get to do this to me.
Josh: What is this about?
Jonathan: Do you see this? Alan? Take a good look.
Alan: You signed it.
Jonathan: That's right, I signed away all the rights to my kid. I was going to give you everything you wanted. You threatened my mother... my family...
[SCENE_BREAK]
Buzz: What happened?
Olivia: I don't, I... Frank, he wants nothing to do with me.
Buzz: He what? ( Laughs ) The house, you were going to...
Olivia: I don't... I, I'm too late. He changed his mind, I guess.
Buzz: Well, I'll call him. You can work this out.
Olivia: No, Buzz, don't do that. Don't... it's just too...
Buzz: Too what?
Olivia: It's embarrassing. Would you just hold me... ( crying )
Buzz: Hey. Gulp. What are we doing? Whatever it is, let's take it slow, okay?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Josh: Hey, whoa, whoa!
Alan: You just made a huge mistake, young man!
Jonathan: No! You made the mistake when you messed with Reva! Because now, you are stuck with me! All of you!
Lizzie: Good going, Granddad.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Harley: Well, at least we're off Alan's radar.
Gus: So, uh... you believe in me?
Harley: I want to. More than anything, I want to.
Gus: Good. That's all I needed to hear.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: You stood up to Alan.
Jonathan: Does that surprise you?
Tammy: No. But did you mean everything you said? You're going to be a part of your daughter's life.
Jonathan: Let's just get out of here, okay?
Tammy: Jonathan...
[SCENE_BREAK]
Rick: Look who's back, everybody!
Mel: Hey! ( Crowd applauds )
Mel: Our daughter, who is fine, by the way, reminded us of what today's about. Which is being with friends and being with family. There's nothing better.
Rick: Nope, nothing. Happy Fourth of July, everybody. Thanks for coming.
Mel: Thank you. ( Fireworks ) ( crowd oohs and aahs ) ( music )
[SCENE_BREAK]
Next, on "Guiding Light"...
Gus: Well, there was good news and there was bad news. Everything starts with good framework.
Harley: What is that? It's like, Daddy, he was willing to give up his whole life for...
Buzz: For you! Some things never change.
Gus: Piece of cake.
